author: TruSTAR

commands.description: Search all TruSTAR incident reports for provided indicators and return all correlated indicators from search results. Two indicators are considered “correlated” if they can be found in a common report.
commands.name: trustar-related-indicators

commands.description: Returns the 10 indicators that have recently appeared in the most community reports. This is analogous to the Community Trends section of the dashboard on Station.
commands.name: trustar-trending-indicators

commands.description: Searches for all indicators that contain the given search term.
commands.name: trustar-search-indicators

commands.description: Submit a new incident report, and receive the ID it has been assigned in TruSTAR’s system.
commands.name: trustar-submit-report

commands.description: Update the report with the specified ID. Either the internal TruSTAR report ID or an external tracking ID can be used. Only the fields passed will be updated. All others will be left unchanged.
commands.name: trustar-update-report

commands.description: Finds a report by its internal or external id.
commands.name: trustar-report-details

commands.description: Deletes a report as specified by given id (id can be TruSTAR report id or external id).
commands.name: trustar-delete-report

commands.description: Returns incident reports matching the specified filters. All parameters are optional: if nothing is specified, the latest 25 reports accessible by the user will be returned (matching the view the user would have by logging into Station).
commands.name: trustar-get-reports

commands.description: Returns a paginated list of all reports that contain any of the provided indicator values.
commands.name: trustar-correlated-reports

commands.description: Searches for all reports that contain the given search term.
commands.name: trustar-search-reports

commands.description: Add to allow list a list of indicator values for the user’s company.
commands.name: trustar-add-to-whitelist

commands.description: Delete an indicator from the user’s company allow list.
commands.name: trustar-remove-from-whitelist

commands.description: Returns the list of all enclaves that the user has access to, as well as whether they can read, create, and update reports in that enclave.
commands.name: trustar-get-enclaves

commands.description: Check file reputation on TruSTAR
commands.name: file

commands.description: Check IP Reputation on TruSTAR
commands.name: ip

commands.description: Check URL reputation on TruSTAR
commands.name: url

commands.description: Check Domain reputation on TruStar
commands.name: domain

commands.description: Fetches all phishing submissions that fit the given criteria
commands.name: trustar-get-phishing-submissions

commands.description: Marks a phishing email submission with one of the phishing namespace tags
commands.name: trustar-set-triage-status

commands.description: Get phishing indicators that match the given criteria.
commands.name: trustar-get-phishing-indicators

integration.description: Deprecated. Use the TruSTAR v2 integration instead.
integration.name: TruSTAR (Deprecated) (Partner Contribution)

commands.description: Searches for all indicators that contain the given search term.
commands.name: trustar-search-indicators

commands.description: Returns the list of all enclaves that the user has access to, as well as whether they can read, create, and update reports in that enclave.
commands.name: trustar-get-enclaves

commands.description: Finds all reports that contain any of the given indicators and returns correlated indicators from those reports.
commands.name: trustar-related-indicators

commands.description: Find indicators that are trending in the community.
commands.name: trustar-trending-indicators

commands.description: Provide metadata associated with a list of indicators, including value, indicatorType, noteCount, sightings, lastSeen, enclaveIds, and tags. The metadata is determined based on the enclaves the user making the request has READ access to.
commands.name: trustar-indicators-metadata

commands.description: Provides structured summaries about indicators, which are derived from intelligence sources on the TruSTAR Marketplace.
commands.name: trustar-indicator-summaries

commands.description: Gets a list of indicators that the user’s company has added to allow list.
commands.name: trustar-get-whitelisted-indicators

commands.description: Returns incident reports matching the specified filters. All parameters are optional: if nothing is specified, the latest 25 reports accessible by the user will be returned (matching the view the user would have by logging into Station).
commands.name: trustar-get-reports

commands.description: Return a list of indicators extracted from a report.
commands.name: trustar-get-indicators-for-report

commands.description: Move a report from one enclave to another.
commands.name: trustar-move-report

commands.description: Copies a report from one enclave to another.
commands.name: trustar-copy-report

commands.description: Submit a new incident report, and receive the ID it has been assigned in TruSTAR’s system.
commands.name: trustar-submit-report

commands.description: Deletes a report as specified by given id (id can be TruSTAR report id or external id).
commands.name: trustar-delete-report

commands.description: Returns a list of all reports that contain any of the provided indicator values.
commands.name: trustar-correlated-reports

commands.description: Finds a report by its ID and returns the report details.
commands.name: trustar-report-details

commands.description: Update the report with the specified ID. Either the internal TruSTAR report ID or an external tracking ID can be used. Only the fields passed will be updated. All others will be left unchanged.
commands.name: trustar-update-report

commands.description: Searches for all reports that contain the given search term.
commands.name: trustar-search-reports

commands.description: Add to allow list a list of indicator values for the user’s company.
commands.name: trustar-add-to-whitelist

commands.description: Delete an indicator from the user’s company allow list.
commands.name: trustar-remove-from-whitelist

commands.description: Fetches all phishing submissions that fit the given criteria
commands.name: trustar-get-phishing-submissions

commands.description: Marks a phishing email submission with one of the phishing namespace tags
commands.name: trustar-set-triage-status

commands.description: Get phishing indicators that match the given criteria.
commands.name: trustar-get-phishing-indicators

integration.description: TruSTAR is an Intelligence Management Platform that helps you operationalize data across tools and teams, helping you prioritize investigations and accelerate incident response.
integration.name: TruSTAR v2 (Partner Contribution)

description: TruSTAR's threat intelligence platform enriches every stage of the security operations workflow from the trusted and relevant data sources.
name: TruSTAR
